intro: Scrophularia nervosa var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed figwort, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth, glabrous surface. Its flowers are usually pale purple or pink, arranged in whorls along the stems, and attract various pollinators. The species is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and is often found in shaded, damp environments.
